intro: Deweya hartwegii, commonly known as the Hartweg's dew plant, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine. Deweya hartwegii plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations.
